title: Realistic threat perception drives intergroup conflict: A causal, dynamic analysis using generative-agent simulations
summary: Human conflict is often attributed to threats against material conditions and symbolic values, yet it remains unclear how they interact and which dominates. Progress is limited by weak causal control, ethical constraints, and scarce temporal data.
